short_reason: CON won by effectively challenging PRO's reliance on Portugal while introducing Oregon's Measure 110 as counter-evidence. PRO failed to adequately respond to the infrastructure distinction or explain how decriminalization would work without robust support systems. CON's weighing of public safety risks (overdose deaths, crime) against PRO's health benefits was more comparative and specific, while PRO largely reasserted claims without addressing CON's core challenge about implementation feasibility.
